comments.body: @CJ-Wright If this is changed to the gitlab archive url (which i guess exists) can the bot pick up changes?

Maybe `RawURL` will pick it up, I'm not certain. Conceivably `RawURL` would also work with the existing URL.

I would happily merge a `source` which gets the tarballs from gitlab!

I mirror fresnel on bitbucket and github. Neither of these embed submodules in the tarballs they generate, so I release by hand at https://glotzerlab.engin.umich.edu/Downloads . The other conda-forge project I maintain, gsd, pulls tarballs from this location and the bot does detect new versions.

If you have a strong preference for gitlab generated tarballs *and* gitlab embeds submodules in its tarballs, I will consider also mirroring fresnel there.
Yeah in that case it'd probably be fine leaving it as is.
